LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_AllowWhite: Don't assume pure white means unset for non humanoids
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_AllowWhiteTooltip: By default Rimworld uses pure white as unset, so it may cause colors to jump quickly towards almost white if we treat white as a real color when it was actually just unset. But goats for example are white and in most cases it's a multiplier so it actually does the right thing anyway like with donkeys. So by default we allow white to be considered real but only for non-humanoids. Untick this if you find your non-humanoid suddenly turning very white far faster than you'd expect from the severity setting
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_ConsiderFloors: Include floors when determining surroundings color
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_ConsiderFloorsToolt: By default we only use buildings to avoid needing to floor the whole map to get a consistent color.\n\nThis will make it look at floors too
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_InfectionHelp: Allow the scenario to add the Chromatic_Sensitivity hediff to pawns
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_OverrideColor: Use selected color for def with given name
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_ColorExclusionLabel: Colors to avoid unless there is no better option
LanguageData.ChromaticSensitivity_DefExclusionLabel: ThingDefs to not consider for chromatic actions
